fields.summary: "Site are unable to send dispense withdrawals for three prescriptions which are currently in the ""Dispensed"" state on the SPINE. The dispense Withdrawal appears to go through successfully but then an error message is returned in the response

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
"Site are unable to send dispense withdrawals for three prescriptions which are currently in the ""Dispensed"" state on the SPINE. The dispense Withdrawal appears to go through successfully but then an error message is returned in the response: ""
    
    hl7:{interactionId}/hl7:communicationFunctionSnd/hl7:device/hl7:id/@extension is missing, empty or invalid"" - Upon checking the HL7 for the Dispenser Withdraw message, the Interaction ID's are present and valid for a withdrawal. This has been raised with both yourselves and our MHS, and from the looks of things the wrong Message Interactions are showing within MDS for this site: nhsAsSvcIA urn:nhs:names:services:mm:PORX_IN150101UK31
     I believe that this should in fact read
     nhsAsSvcIA urn:nhs:names:services:mm:PORX_IN*51*0101UK31"

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: CP-IS Acknowledgement Response Files Produced are Schema Invalid for Failed Records

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
A defect has been identified with the CP-IS Client whereby the CP-IS Local Authority Acknowledgement Response (REPC_MT000003GB01) files that are returned are not always schema valid. The problem occurs where the record has not been accepted by the CP-IS Client for any reason and an invalidCP-ISRecord is returned in the file. When an invalidCP-ISRecord is returned the record is missing the pertinentInformation element.

This issue has been identified whilst Integration Testing with the Local Authority System Suppliers in the Spine2 INT environment but this is an issue with the LIVE CP-IS Client.

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

fields.summary: Non NBO organisations not showing correct org types on DSA.

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
Allocations made using DSA by non-NBO organisations do not have the correct organisation and registering authority types recorded.

User's Name
    Jane STEWART
<##eof##>

User's phone
    0113 397 4357
<##eof##>

User's email
    jane.stewart4@nhs.net
<##eof##>

User's UUID (Smartcard ID)
    536201248567
<##eof##>

Hospital / Site
    [X26] Health And Social Care Information Centre
<##eof##>

Steps to Recreate the Incident - How did I get here? 
    Non-NBO user at Northern Lincolnshire and Goole (RJL) with access to DSA Allocates an NHS Number. When this Allocation is viewed in the PDS Allocations report it has a Registering Organisation of XDC and a Registering Authority Type of 'I'. NHS Number example 7125469477 allocated on 23/01/2015 at 10:01. The end user at the trust is not affected because they can use the NHS Number returned, however, it affects monitoring of Trust Allocations by PDS NBO because the organisation and registering authority type is not recorded correctly.
<##eof##>

What steps have been taken so far to resolve the incident 
    This NIN. Checked DSA business requirements which state Cross organisation access will now be supported and reportable.
<##eof##>

Justification of Impact
    The impact is that allocations made by organisations using DSA that are non-NBO will not have allocations monitored because they are not recorded correctly. In the Allocations report NBO will not monitor allocations showing against NBO type 'I'. This means that duplicates may be created. 
<##eof##>

fields.summary: Incorrect validation of GP2GP messages by spine

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
Ive been asked to notify you of an error I believe is happening in spine. At the moment, the first GP system is being tested for delivery of GP2GP Phase 2.2a, so this issue has only so far been seen in a test environment.

When a GP2GP Phase 2.2a EHR Extract is sent (RCMR_IN030000UK06) which includes large attachments, the large attachments are listed in ebXML the manifest of the RCMR_IN030000UK06 but are sent separately over Common Point to Point messaging (COPC_IN000001UK01).

The items which are sent as mime parts of the RCMR_IN030000UK06 are listed with xref values beginning cid: whereas those being sent as separate COPC_IN000001UK01 messages have xref values beginning with mid: .

Can you please let me know how I should properly raise this issue?

The following query pulls out a sample log entry from splunk:
https://nww.int.spine2.ncrs.nhs.uk/splunk/en-GB/app/search/flashtimeline?q=search%20index%3D*%20%22internalID%3D20150217154750389307_A1BC1B_1081778281%22%20%22MPS0170%22&earliest=0

status.description: A state where issue accuracy, priority/severity and scheduling is resolved
status.name: Triage Assigned

fields.summary: Prescription status error on EPS.

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents

fields.description:
EPS Prescription Tracker
    
    Prescription Tracker is showing an anomaly for some prescriptions. Prescription resets were requested for 27 prescriptions by Helix. When the EPS team clinician reviewed these prescriptions to determine if approval could be given or not three repeat dispensing prescriptions were found to have a 'message' of 'Dispense Notification successful' but a status of 'awaiting release'. In order to be able to determine if it is appropriate for approval to reset a prescription the exact status of the prescription must be known.
    A word document showing the three IDs and screenshots is attached. The EPS clinicians need to know the correct status of each issue of each of the three RD prescriptions.

fields.summary: Unable to download some prescriptions.

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
Unable to download some prescriptions.
    
    Hi,
    
    The above customer have raised a number of prescriptions that they have been unable to download as they are coming up with "Prescription with another dispenser"
    
    Previously, these have been raised to the EPS programme team to reset the prescriptions. The site have again escalated a further 16 prescriptions that have the same error where the pharmacy is their own address and NACs code.
    
    This has prompted further investigation into why this is happening. I've done a search for the affected prescriptions and we cannot see them coming through our MHS.
    
    I have checked and I can see that the customer has two EPRs. One for us and one for their old supplier (Helix).
    
    Please can the following prescriptions be checked to see whether the nominated download attempts downloaded to which of the following party keys:
    
    YGH-805568
    YGM82-807142
    
    If they are downloading to YGM82-807142, please can this be passed to the Helix to request the removal of this EPR?

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.summary: EMIS have looked at Spine messages which appear to be malformed.

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
EMIS is an MHS for RX Systems. 
    They have reported that they have received a large influx of calls due to unable to download a prescription as its with another dispenser.
    However when EMIS has looked at the messages sent by Spine, they appear to be malformed (truncated)
    
    Example messageID is 03D5EB7A-136A-411A-9D99-2675A49AFE05.
    ConversationID 5CD6F82E-E044-43CF-88E9-B7334EF17266.
    
    The message was received on 2015-03-17 09:47:45.
    
    This message sent from Spine is truncated within the content. 
    Can you please check this and advise? Can you also advise of any changes made to RX Systems or to the Spine system within the past 24 hours.
    
    It is only as of today that this issue has been experienced.
    
    Thanks

fields.summary: I raised a service call (NIN 736775) with an issue that was causing schema invalid messages.  You reported to us that you had fixed the data issue.  However, the data issue continues to be evident and patient searches are failing as a result.  For example

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
I raised a service call (NIN 736775) with an issue that was causing schema invalid messages.  You reported to us that you had fixed the data issue.  However, the data issue continues to be evident and patient searches are failing as a result.  For example on 10/03/2015, there was 10 schema validation failures with the same problem.  Our logs say "Invalid content was found starting with element "effectiveTime".  No child element is expected at this point".
    
    Please can you fix the issue?
    
    thanks
    Linda Marshall

fields.summary: DSA - Right side of allocate screen overlaps the left side

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
JIRA SP11-6397 applied a change to DSA Allocate screen in R 3.4.0.11.  This has resulted in the right side of the screen overlapping the left on 19 inch monitors (see screen shot attached) Colin Bateson has advised this issue had been already been detected and should have been fixed in the same release (JIRA Ref unknown).

User needs to reduce zoom to 75% to be able to activate the drop down boxes and view all data entered in the left hand side of the screen..

Fix has been requested as a hot fix.

fields.summary: ### NO COMMS ### Prescriptions are not being cancelled correctly by users

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
Prescribers deselecting default tick on clinical system, to cancel prescriptions on the Spine and ending course of medication. This has resulted in prescriptions available for dispensing on Spine, where the prescriber intended to cancel them. User functionality error. No other way to now cancel prescriptions and prevent pharmacies being able to download and dispense the medication. 
    
    We require the Spine 2 team to cancel these prescriptions on behalf of the users due to user error

fields.summary: on a Thursday ONS provide SPINE with a file of Civil Birth Registrations which are added to SPINE some weeks this has been delayed. Can you please advice what caused the delay.

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
Each week on a Thursday ONS provide SPINE with a file of Civil Birth Registrations which are added to SPINE. Any birth registrations added to SPINE are provided to NBO on a daily basis in CHRIS Demographic Birth Update files. Therefore NBO expect to receive the bulk of the birth data in the batch sent to NBO on a Thursday. Since the beginning of February there have been 3 occasions where the bulk of the data has not been sent until the following day. NBO have not been made aware of any expected delay by ONS. Therefore could you please advise what caused the delay in the data being sent for the following weeks:
    W/C 2/2/2015 (Bulk of data received in File Seq No 1810 received on Fri 6/2/2015)
    W/C 9/2/2015  (Bulk of data received in File Seq No 1817 received on Fri 13/2/2015)
    W/C 2/3/2015  (Bulk of data received in File Seq No 1838 received on Fri 6/3/2015)

fields.summary: Error received when IG privacy alert sent (viewing an SCR that requires legal or clinical overrides).

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
The SCR development team have come across a problem relating to IG privacy alerts (viewing an SCR that requires legal or clinical overrides).  The solution (prior to them working on it) appears to already cater for this feature, however it is currently not working, and we would like to determine if this is an issue with our solution.

It is a repeatable error that is occurring every time we attempt to send an IG privacy alert sent message (when accessing an SCR via legal override).

fields.summary: SPINE 2 - M&V - Failing to extract the data at Splunk report

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
Raised By:
SREENIVASARAO YERRA
sreenivasarao.yerra@hscic.gov.uk

We are trying to perform Add and update using the different batch files and we found that there are number of issues observed to investigate further.

Add  Allocate

1.	Successful Number Allocations  failing to pick up the data based on the allocation complete.
2.	Record Validation Failures  this is reporting correctly but we would require to strip out the correct row number as it is reading different from expected.
3.	Failed Number Allocations  We are failing to extract the data for failed number allocations.

Edit  Update

1.	Successful Updates - failing to pick up the data based on the updates complete.
2.	Failed updates  We are failing to extract the data for failed updates.

fields.summary: Issues with CHRIS validation- problem with 2 lines on known issue.

issuetype.description: Either Cherwell Incidents or HPSM Incidents
issuetype.name: Incident

fields.description:
CHRIS Demographic General Update file 2,996 received 06/03/15 at 20:49 has failed CHRIS validation. Investigations have concluded that two records within the file have wrapped across two lines causing it to fail CHRIS validation. 
    
    Record 612 369 0841 (type 8) row 6313 and 6314. 
    Record 600 121 5251 (type 2) row 48,456 and 48,457 
    
    Same issue as NIN 729379 (JIRA 14294 + 14306).

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed
